comments.body: Any reason not to use `AutoCloseable` instead?

It's not used in a try-with-resources block right now, and it's pretty unlikely that it will be. This also follows the precedent with the [CloseableOffsetStorageReader](https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/0f68dc7a640b26a8edea154ea4ea2b6d93b5104b/connect/runtime/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/connect/storage/CloseableOffsetStorageReader.java) class, which is also not `AutoCloseable`.

Not really attached either way, happy to change to `AutoCloseable` if there's a reason to.
It's more that `Closeable` is the legacy interface and we don't have strict requirements on throwing `IOException` or this call being idempotent.
